title: Pointed set
summary: In mathematics, a pointed set[1][2] (also based set[1] or rooted set[3]) is an ordered pair ( X , x 0 ) {\displaystyle (X,x_{0})} where X {\displaystyle X} is a set and x 0 {\displaystyle x_{0}} is an element of X {\displaystyle X} called the base point,[2] also spelled basepoint.[4]: 10–11
